title: About the existing order or written agreement

pages.name: About the existing order or written agreement

elements.name: ifNeitherexistingFAQ
elements.title: In a previous step you identified that you had an existing order or written agreement about spousal support. If you need an order about spousal support, and there is no order or written agreement already in place, please return to the Background step and de-select spousal support under the 'Please select which family law matter issue your existing written agreement or court order is about' question

elements.name: ifExistingFAQ
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your written agreement(s) or court order(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: filedWithDirector
elements.title: Is your order or agreement filed with the Director of Maintenance Enforcement to help with collecting spousal support?

elements.name: ifExistingFAQ
elements.title: If your order or written agreement is filed with the Director of Maintenance Enforcement, you must serve a copy of the application on the director. The Director of Maintenance Enforcement can be served by mailing the documents to the postal address provided by the director. Contact the Family Maintenance Enforcement Program to find out how best to serve them.

elements.name: reviewableTerm
elements.title: Does the existing order or written agreement include a term that the spousal support can or will be reviewed?
elements.description: An order or written agreement can include a term that spousal support be reviewed on a specified date or after a specified time or event or you may be applying for a review of spousal support because you or your spouse has started receiving or is eligible to start receiving benefits under a pension.

elements.name: ifReviewableFAQ
elements.title:
You may instead complete the Request for Scheduling Form 39 to request a court appearance to review spousal support.

Under section 168 and 169 of the Family Law Act, at a review of spousal support a court can do one or more of the following:
  • confirm that the terms about spousal support in the agreement or order remain appropriate
  • set aside (cancel) all or part of the agreement or terminate (cancel) the order
  • make a new order for spousal support under section 165 of the Family Law Act.
Asking for a review of spousal support under section 168 and 169 of the Family Law Act is different from asking to change or cancel an existing agreement or order about spousal support.

If you are not sure how to proceed, we recommend you talk with a child support officer (they can also help with spousal support), family justice counsellor or a lawyer.

choices.text: I want to complete the Request for Scheduling Form 39. Note: Completion of the form is not currently supported by this service. If you select this option, a fillable PDF version of the form will be opened in another window for you to complete.
I want to continue my application about an existing order or written agreement about spousal support.
